title: Ticket #4291: Overlayed I/O with dedicated transfer slots
description:
User-visible information available on the wiki here: ExperimentalOverlayedFileTransfer

The latest approach for overlaying execution of jobs with the transferring of the output sandbox. Full details in Design Doc

Have the following in your condor_config: 

$EXPERIMENTAL : ASYNC_STAGEOUT
which is equivalent to 
# append cluster ID to StarterLog, may be: Cluster, JobId, false or true. true gives 8.0 compatible behavior.
ALLOW_SLOT_PAIRING=true
STARTER_LOG_NAME_APPEND=false
# create a type2 xfer slot for every type1 slot
NUM_SLOTS_TYPE_1 = $(NUM_CPUS)
NUM_SLOTS_TYPE_2 = $(NUM_SLOTS_TYPE_1)
SLOT_TYPE_2 = minimal cpus=0.1 memory=100 disk=auto
SLOT_TYPE_2_NAME_PREFIX = xfer
SLOT_TYPE_2_PAIRED_WITH = SLOT_TYPE_1
SLOT_TYPE_2_HIDDEN = true
SLOT_TYPE_2_START = TARGET.JobTransferringOutput  && splitslotname(TARGET.RemoteHost)[1] == splitslotname(MY.Name)[1]
STARTD_SLOT_ATTRS = $(STARTD_SLOT_ATTRS) State Activity EnteredCurrentActivity JobId GlobalJobId
For testing I modified this slightly, and changed a few things to make HTCondor more "interactive": 
NUM_SLOTS_TYPE_1 = 1
SLOT_TYPE_2_HIDDEN = false
SCHEDD_INTERVAL = 5
UPDATE_INTERVAL = 5

Here's the submit file I'm using for testing async.sub: 

universe = vanilla
executable = async.sh

should_transfer_files = ALWAYS
when_to_transfer_output = ON_EXIT_OR_EVICT

+wantioproxy = True

output = a.$(Cluster).$(Process).out
error = a.$(Cluster).$(Process).err

log = a.log

notification = never
requirements = (CPUS >= 1)

queue 4

You can use streaming out and error if you want, but be warned that reconnect won't work:

stream_output = True
stream_error = True
And here is the script async.sh: 
#!/bin/sh

echo "I AM:"
whoami
hostname
uname -a

echo "ENV:"
env

echo "executing for 120 seconds..."
touch executing
sleep 120

echo /scratch.1/zmiller/build/release_dir//libexec/condor_chirp phase output
/scratch.1/zmiller/build/release_dir//libexec/condor_chirp phase output

echo "transferring for 120 seconds..."
touch transferring
sleep 120

rm executing transferring

echo THAT IS ALL!

exit 0

Here is a template you can use to run "condor_status -pr pairs.pr": 

# condor_status query for slot pairs, use with condor_status -direct to see hidden pairs.
SELECT
   # Machine WIDTH AUTO
   splitslotname(Name)[0] AS SlotName WIDTH -8
   IfThenElse(SlotPairName isnt undefined,splitslotname(SlotPairName)[0],"-") AS Paired
   Strcat(Arch,"_",IfThenElse(OpSys=="WINDOWS",OpSysShortName,OpSysAndVer)) AS Platform
   Cpus AS Cpus PRINTF "%.3f"
   # IfThenElse(GPUs isnt undefined,GPUs,0) AS GPUs PRINTF "%4d"
   Memory WIDTH 6
   Disk       WIDTH 8
   EnteredCurrentActivity AS "  StatusTime"  PRINTAS ACTIVITY_TIME NOPREFIX
   Strcat(State,"/",Activity) AS Status WIDTH -14 TRUNCATE
   ifthenelse(JobId isnt undefined, JobId, "") AS JobID
remarks:
2014-Apr-09 17:49:42 by bbockelm:
Hi -

When I try the suggested config, I get: 

04/09/14 17:45:42 ERROR: Can't allocate 1st slot of type 2
        Requesting: slot type 2: Cpus: 0.100000, Memory: 100, Swap: 0.78%, Disk: auto, BANDWIDTH: 0
        Available:  Slot #2: Cpus: 0, Memory: 0, Swap: 0.00%, Disk: 0.00%, BANDWIDTH: 0
04/09/14 17:45:42 ERROR "Ran out of system resources" at line 122 in file /home/cse496/bbockelm/projects/condor/src/condor_startd.V6/slot_builder.cpp

Suggestions?

2014-Apr-11 12:08:24 by zmiller:
You had partitionable slots enabled, which currently isn't compatible with Async IO. HTCondor now prints a more friendly error message in that case.

2015-Mar-18 16:15:13 by smoler:
Wiki page completed.
